base_description: Rectangular sliding glass window with a white frame.
part_description: Two large glass panes, each with a black handle, set within a white rectangular frame. The panes are positioned side by side, allowing one to slide over the other.
internal_interaction_description: The two glass panes are mounted on tracks within the frame, enabling one pane to slide horizontally in front of or behind the other. This sliding mechanism allows for easy opening and closing, facilitated by the handles attached to each pane.
external_interaction_description: The window can be opened or closed by sliding the panes using the handles. It allows light and air to pass through when open and provides visibility and insulation when closed. The window interacts with external elements like weather conditions, impacting indoor temperature and lighting.
